thread.title: Blue shoes net Lions' Stafford $5.7K fine
thread.title_full: Blue shoes net Lions' Stafford $5.7K fine

author: detroitnews.com
title: Blue shoes net Lions' Stafford $5.7K fine
text:
Lions quarterback Matthew Stafford jogs off the field after warm-ups, wearing the all blue shoes, before Detroit takes on the Seattle Seahawks in Seattle. (Photo: Daniel Mears, Detroit News) 
Allen Park 
— Lions quarterback Matthew Stafford received a fine from the NFL for the cleats he wore during the team’s loss to the Seattle Seahawks Monday.
Stafford wore all blue cleats during the game while most other players wore shoes with a color scheme with some combination of black, white and pink. NFL players receive a $5,787 fine for their first offense of the league’s uniform policy, and Stafford will appeal his fine.
Stafford said he wore the same cleats throughout the preseason and in the Lions’ first three games. He also recalled that former Lions Ndamukong Suh and Reggie Bush wore the same shoes each game last season.
A request for an explanation from a league spokesman has not yet been returned.
jkatzenstein@detroitnews.com 
twitter.com/jkatzenstein
